_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Reflections to be made by a mendicant [m: Was there any desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in my heart for sights known by the eye?
Was there any desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in my heart for sounds known by the ear?
Was there any desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in my heart for smells known by the nose?
Was there any desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in my heart for tastes known by the tongue?
Was there any desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in my heart for touches known by the body?
Was there any desire or greed or hate or delusion or repulsion in my heart for thoughts known by the mind?
Have I given up the five kinds of sensual stimulation?
Have I given up the five hindrances?
Have I completely understood the five grasping aggregates?
Have I developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation?
Have I developed the four right efforts?
Have I developed the four bases of psychic power?
Have I developed the five faculties?
Have I developed the five powers?
Have I developed the seven awakening factors?
Have I developed the noble eightfold path?
Have I developed serenity and discernment?
Have I realized knowledge and freedom?
The training to be done by mendicants [m: They should make an effort to give up those unskillful qualities.
They should meditate with rapture and joy, training day and night in skillful qualities.
